com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller.opmodes

Class TeleOpOctopus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
      • com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller.opmodes.TeleOpOctopus
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TeleOpBlue, TeleOpRed

    public abstract class TeleOpOctopus
extends com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
    contains all the code to run TeleOp, it has no inherent side

      TeleOpOctopus() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void angleArm()
      sets the angle of the arm this is controlled by OpMode.gamepad2 left stick y axis
      void attachments()
      this processes all inputs that do not affect the movement of the wheels
      private void climberDumper()
      dumps the climber if the OpMode.gamepad2 y button is pressed
      private void collector()
      Runs the collector in is OpMode.gamepad2 right bumper out is OpMode.gamepad2left bumper
      private void drive()
      this processes inputs directly related to moving the wheels
      private void dumping()
      pressing OpMode.gamepad2 dpad right while blue or OpMode.gamepad2 dpad left while red slides dumper across the hopper, bringing the debris with it as this happens the proper release door (doorR or doorL) opens
      private void getInput()
      receives input from joystick and writes it to variables OpMode.gamepad1 left stick y axis controls forwards and backwards OpMode.gamepad1 right stick x axis controls rotation
      void init(int sideInput)
      this maps all of our variables to the hardware
      void loop()
      all this does is starts the runs the functions that actually process inputs and do the driving
      private void processArm()
      runs everything involving extending and retracting the main dumper arm ext and synchronizing it with pullUp1 and pullUp2 the arm is extended by OpMode.gamepad2 right trigger and retracted by OpMode.gamepad2 left trigger OpMode.gamepad2 a button tightens the arm if the arm is fully retracted, the arm cannot retract more became extStop is pressed
      private void processInput()
      processes input to form a complete power for each wheel it also the input values to avoid errors
      private void setPower()
      sets power also clips the speed to avoid errors and slows down the robot if required
      private void slowRobot()
      if OpMode.gamepad1 right trigger is pressed, it causes the robot to slow down
      void stop()
      there are no special stop events

      • Methods inherited from class com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode

        getRuntime, init_loop, init, resetStartTime, start

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(int sideInput)
        this maps all of our variables to the hardware
        Parameters:
        sideInput - this is given by our separate programs that reference this file so that autonomous knows weather it is red or blue. 1=blue, -1=red

      • loop

        public void loop()
        all this does is starts the runs the functions that actually process inputs and do the driving
        Specified by:
        loop in class com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
        See Also:
        drive(), attachments()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        there are no special stop events

      • drive

        private void drive()
        this processes inputs directly related to moving the wheels
        See Also:
        getInput(), processInput(), slowRobot(), setPower()

      • attachments

        public void attachments()
        this processes all inputs that do not affect the movement of the wheels
        See Also:
        collector(), dumping(), climberDumper(), processArm(), angleArm()

      • collector

        private void collector()
        Runs the collector in is OpMode.gamepad2 right bumper out is OpMode.gamepad2left bumper

      • dumping

        private void dumping()
        pressing OpMode.gamepad2 dpad right while blue or OpMode.gamepad2 dpad left while red slides dumper across the hopper, bringing the debris with it as this happens the proper release door (doorR or doorL) opens

      • climberDumper

        private void climberDumper()
        dumps the climber if the OpMode.gamepad2 y button is pressed

      • processArm

        private void processArm()
        runs everything involving extending and retracting the main dumper arm ext and synchronizing it with pullUp1 and pullUp2 the arm is extended by OpMode.gamepad2 right trigger and retracted by OpMode.gamepad2 left trigger OpMode.gamepad2 a button tightens the arm if the arm is fully retracted, the arm cannot retract more became extStop is pressed

      • angleArm

        private void angleArm()
        sets the angle of the arm this is controlled by OpMode.gamepad2 left stick y axis

      • getInput

        private void getInput()
        receives input from joystick and writes it to variables OpMode.gamepad1 left stick y axis controls forwards and backwards OpMode.gamepad1 right stick x axis controls rotation

      • processInput

        private void processInput()
        processes input to form a complete power for each wheel it also the input values to avoid errors

      • setPower

        private void setPower()
        sets power also clips the speed to avoid errors and slows down the robot if required
        See Also:
        fr, br, fl, bl

      • slowRobot

        private void slowRobot()
        if OpMode.gamepad1 right trigger is pressed, it causes the robot to slow down
